thread.title: Orlando City unveils seats honoring Pulse nightclub shooting victims
thread.title_full: Orlando City unveils seats honoring Pulse nightclub shooting victims

title: Orlando City unveils seats honoring Pulse nightclub shooting victims
text:
Orlando City unveils seats honoring Pulse nightclub shooting victims Naples Daily News 0 Jan 4, 2017 4:16:04 PM Orlando City unveiled 49 rainbow-colored seats at its new stadium Wednesday to honor the victims of the June shooting at Pulse nightclub. 
Orlando City unveiled 49 rainbow-colored seats at its new stadium Wednesday, marking a touching tribute to the victims of the June shooting at Pulse nightclub. 
The MLS side will kick off at its soccer-specific venue with a match against New York City FC on March 5, and the 25,500-seat stadium will feature a poignant reminder of the 49 people who died during the June 12 shooting in Orlando. — Orlando City SC (@OrlandoCitySC) January 4, 2017 . @OrlandoCitySC and @OCPres just unveiled the 49 seats to honor the victims of #Pulse . #OrlandoUnited pic.twitter.com/OqQeb9KsxA — Christian Bruey (@CBrueyWFTV) January 4, 2017 
Orlando City previously honored the victims with a number of gestures during a match against the San Jose Earthquakes on June 18, including a stoppage of play in the 49th minute. Related
